headline: Morgan Stanley Insider Sale And Trade Views Shape Risk And Value Narrative
summary: Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) co president Daniel A. Simkowitz recently sold company stock, drawing attention to executive activity at the bank. The firm’s Chief Investment Officer is separately outlining views on multiyear shifts in global trade and investment patterns under the Trump administration. Together, the insider sale and public commentary are giving investors fresh information on how Morgan Stanley’s leadership is thinking about risk, capital allocation and global opportunity. headline: Morgan Stanley (MS) Valuation Check After Strong Q4 2025 Results And Rebound In Investment Banking
summary: Morgan Stanley (MS) is back in focus after strong Q4 2025 results highlighted a rebound in investment banking revenue and steady momentum in wealth management, prompting investors to reassess the stock’s risk and return trade off. See our latest analysis for Morgan Stanley. The recent Q4 2025 earnings surprise, insider share sale by co president Daniel A. Simkowitz and a series of fresh fixed income offerings have come against a backdrop of a 10.73% 90 day share price return and a 37.32% 1...

headline: Morgan Stanley Inclusive & Sustainable Ventures Hosts Global Demo Day, Opens Applications for Next Cohort
summary: NEW YORK, February 04, 2026--Morgan Stanley (NYSE: MS) today is hosting its annual global Inclusive & Sustainable Ventures (MSISV) Demo Day, with startups and nonprofits participating from across the Americas, Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA). The organizations will pitch over 300 investors, as well as potential business partners and customers.
